description.narrative: Contribute to further reducing maternal and child mortality in rural Rwanda while improving equity and efficiency

The project targets children under 6 years old. However, due to the 5X5 model their mothers and other mothers of the reproductive age are targeted to change their behaviours towards child survival activities through the empowerment of Community Health Workers in health and nutrition services delivery.

"Home visits" is used for pregnant and lactating women who have children of less than one year of age. "Home-based childcare early childhood development groups. This strategy is used for children of 1 to 3 years old and involves self-selected groups of 8-10 mothers organizing community-based child care groups focusing on early childhood development. Mothers rotate in taking care of children. Each day a different mother takes a turn as the “caregiver,” staying with the children while the other mothers are working in their respective fields or went to market for small trade, etc. The location remains constant, the home of a mother or a community structure, and must meet certain criteria agreed upon by all the mothers. 3. Center-based ECD for children 3 to 6 years: All mothers are trained in early child development and stimulation, child safety, protection and rights and maternal and child health. "Early Childhood Development". This is a center based ECD integrating child survival (i.e. health and nutrition) services in ECD activities. I takes into account children of 3 to 6 years old. ECD has two volunteers: A teached and a second person resposnible for cooking porridge for children and cleaning the center.
